Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Performance Issues Regarding Cloned Rows‚Äã" (#1954) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
When generating Excel via OpenXML, we first prepare a template Excel file. We then clone a specified range (approximately 50 rows) from the template to the target Excel using CloneNode(true), preserving all cell styles and values within this range. Based on the data volume, we paginate the content, cloning from the template for each new page.

Each cloning operation takes over 30 milliseconds. With 2000 pages of data in total, this results in more than one minute of processing time. The current performance is considered unacceptable. Are there any more efficient approaches?

`(Row)sourceRow.CloneNode(true);   // Each invocation of this method consumes roughly 2ms.`

`commentParts` attribute on `SlidePart` should be `CommentParts` (capitol C)

Information

Opened pull request "Bump actions/download-artifact from 4 to 5" (#1957) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Bumps [actions/download-artifact](https://github.com/actions/download-artifact) from 4 to 5.
Release notes

Sourced from actions/download-artifact's releases.

v5.0.0

What's Changed

  • Update README.md by @‚Äãnebuk89 in actions/download-artifact#407
  • BREAKING fix: inconsistent path behavior for single artifact downloads by ID by @‚ÄãGrantBirki in actions/download-artifact#416

v5.0.0

üö® Breaking Change

This release fixes an inconsistency in path behavior for single artifact downloads by ID. If you're downloading single artifacts by ID, the output path may change.

What Changed

Previously, single artifact downloads behaved differently depending on how you specified the artifact:

  • By name: name: my-artifact ‚Üí extracted to path/ (direct)
  • By ID: artifact-ids: 12345 ‚Üí extracted to path/my-artifact/ (nested)

Now both methods are consistent:

  • By name: name: my-artifact ‚Üí extracted to path/ (unchanged)
  • By ID: artifact-ids: 12345 ‚Üí extracted to path/ (fixed - now direct)

Migration Guide

‚úÖ No Action Needed If:
  • You download artifacts by name
  • You download multiple artifacts by ID
  • You already use merge-multiple: true as a workaround
‚ö†Ô∏è Action Required If:

You download single artifacts by ID and your workflows expect the nested directory structure.

Before v5 (nested structure):

- uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
  with:
    artifact-ids: 12345
    path: dist
# Files were in: dist/my-artifact/

Where my-artifact is the name of the artifact you previously uploaded

To maintain old behavior (if needed):

</tr></table>
